documenttitle.text: Red Hat Bug Fix Advisory: Ansible 2.9.6 release for Ansible Engine 2.9

note.text:
Ansible is a simple model-driven configuration management, multi-node
deployment, and remote-task execution system. Ansible works over SSH and
does not require any software or daemons to be installed on remote nodes.
Extension modules can be written in any language and are transferred to
managed machines automatically.

The following packages have been upgraded to a newer upstream version:
ansible (2.9.6)

Bug Fix(es):

See:
https://github.com/ansible/ansible/blob/v2.9.6/changelogs/CHANGELOG-v2.9.rst
for details on bug fixes in this release.
note.title: Details

note.title: Terms of Use

documentdistribution.text: Copyright Â© 2023 Red Hat, Inc. All rights reserved.

note.text: A flaw was found in the use of insufficiently random values in Ansible. Two random password lookups of the same length generate the equal value as the template caching action for the same file since no re-evaluation happens. The highest threat from this vulnerability would be that all passwords are exposed at once for the file.
note.title: Vulnerability Description

description.text:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes
described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

reference.Description: bz#1831089: CVE-2020-10729 Ansible: two random password lookups in same task return same value

acknowledgment.Description: Red Hat would like to thank Rihards Olups for reporting this issue.
